title: Loss Prevention
body:
Why is it not so the case where if a teammate is afk for longer than say, half the total game time or even almost 100% of the total game time, the looser dose not get a loss prevention? This is the case in games like CS, but not here? why? I don't see a downside to implementing this so what seems to be the case?
My previous game had me smashing my opponent, my mid laner annihilating her partner and our bot lane getting harassed 3v2 consistently because our jungler dc'd after killing blue 3 mins in.
I'm mad.

replies.body: Loss prevention systems are also extremely abusable, I believe it would be used correctly maybe 1 in 10 applications.

Loss prevented systems are problematic because you have one team not loosing MMR, but the enemy still gaining MMR. So as a side effect the whole MMR system gets de-calibrated for a while. This is one of the reasons why our own [Loss Prevented system](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201753014-Loss-Prevented) is used extremely infrequently and only gives 50% MMR gains to the winners.

You can always make a loss prevented system that only cuts LP losses though.

Loss prevention is manually turned on whe there are server difficulties. Not manually turned on when someone is having trouble connecting or just flat out left in one of the many league games that are played at the same time.

He is talking about losing LP in ranked when some asshole goes afk or doesn't even try. Or just flat out leaves after the remake function.

The fact you lose LP or rank due to one asshole is very frustrating for most people.

It is true it COULD be abused but it would be easy to regulate that and they could make it not enabled for 5 man/4 man teams.
